page.title: 19REMINISCENCE IN RHYME
page.content:
Times of Change by Mrs.Ruby Carne.
I grew up in Northchapel long,long ago When times were hard and life was slow The hungry twenties & thirties we knew With money scarce and jobs so few.
But all our neighbours we knew by name None were better off,all were the same Husbands went for miles jobs to find, And took what was offered,of any kind.
Now we have come some fifty years on Those early hardships certainly gone. We're now in the 80's,progressed afar But I can't see how much better we are
Now having reached three score and ten I see such difference tween now & then With living standards improved a lot But is anyone happier,I think not.
